candidates.title: Pre-0.3.0 changes
candidates.body:
- Fix an intra-doc link.
- Add feature flags to docs.rs documentation.

candidates.title: Migrate to bls12_381 and jubjub crates
candidates.body: Closes #170. Closes #171.

candidates.title: Update bls12_381 subtree
candidates.body: Pulls in https://github.com/zkcrypto/bls12_381/commit/d0ea5d4958cae999dea1800207704171aa07a9ef

candidates.title: zcash_proofs: Add LocalProver::bundled
candidates.body: Requires the `bundled-prover` feature for the `zcash_proofs` crate, which enables the `wagyu-zcash-parameters` crate and adds around 50 MiB to the overall binary size. That crate bundles the same Sapling parameter files we normally obtain from disk, so we constrain them to match the same hard-coded hashes.

candidates.title: Move Equihash verifier into equihash crate
candidates.body: This enables it to be used independently from `zcash_primitives`, such as in `zebrad`.

candidates.title: zcash_client_sqlite crate
candidates.body:
My [`note-spending-v7`](https://github.com/str4d/librustzcash/tree/note-spending-v7) branch is pretty stable at this point, and now being depended on more widely (after the ECC wallet was recently open-sourced). I rebased my branch on current master to fix merge conflicts (due to recent refactors), but it's otherwise unaltered.

Closes #71.

candidates.title: Implement group and pairing traits for bls12_381 and jubjub crates
candidates.body: Closes #163. Closes #167. Closes #169.

candidates.title: pairing: Bound Engine::Gt on Group instead of Field
Lint fixes
candidates.body: Addresses lints that are [visible when checking with nightly](https://github.com/zcash/librustzcash/pull/205/files) (rather than the current MSRV of 1.39).

candidates.title: group crate refactoring
candidates.body:
The new `Group` trait represents a cryptographic group with a large prime-order subgroup and a small cofactor. The `PrimeGroup` trait further constrains the group to have a cofactor of one. `CurveProjective` now primarily contains EC-specific functionality.

Part of #161.

candidates.title: ff: More trait refactoring
candidates.body: Addresses trait-related comments from @ebfull on #227.

candidates.title: Implement ff traits for bls12_381 and jubjub crates
candidates.body: Closes #160 and #166.

candidates.title: Remove ff::PrimeFieldRepr

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

candidates.body: Closes #159.

candidates.title: Remove Cargo.lock
candidates.body: Now that the `librustzcash` crate has been removed from the repository and workspace, there are no crates that generate binary artifacts, and cargo ignores `Cargo.lock` when publishing library crates.

candidates.title: Remove librustzcash crate
candidates.body:
This crate now lives in https://github.com/zcash/zcash, which is the
sole intended consumer of the C FFI.

candidates.title: Clippy cleanups

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

candidates.body: Making progress towards being able to enable clippy lints in CI.

candidates.title: Speed up Field::invert and SqrtField::sqrt in ff_derive with addition chains
candidates.body: Currently uses the Bergeron-Berstel-Brlek-Duboc algorithm (via the `addchain` crate) to generate addition chains, which speeds up `Field::invert` and `SqrtField::sqrt` for `pairing::bls12_381` by around 15%.

candidates.title: ff::Field::pow_vartime and no_std support

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

candidates.body: Part of #159.

candidates.title: More ff::Field operator refactoring

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

candidates.body: Part of #159.

candidates.title: New BLS12-381 and Jubjub implementations
candidates.body: This PR brings in `0.1.0` of the `bls12_381` crate, and `0.3.0` of the `jubjub` crate.

candidates.title: Pass bellman's multicore feature flag through to zcash_proofs
candidates.body: This enables someone using zcash_proofs to disable multicore.

candidates.title: Fix rand_os warning in tests
candidates.body: Warnings were originally fixed in #134. This warning was introduced in #114, but it wasn't spotted because there was no merge conflict.

candidates.title: Specify rand_core >= 0.5.1 for OsRng import.
candidates.body:
Fixes issue introduced by #134. `rand_core` 0.5.0 does not export `OsRng` in the crate root but 0.5.1 does.

@NikVolf

candidates.title: More crate updates
candidates.body: Includes a fix for a `bellman` compile bug introduced in #104.

candidates.title: MMR trees API
candidates.body:
according to emerging spec here: https://github.com/zcash/zips/pull/220

Not sure it belongs here or to the separate lib!

The main design goals of this mmr implementation were
1. Avoid database callbacks. As it is implemented, calling side must just smartly pre-load MMR nodes from the database (about log2(tree length) for append, twice as much for deletion).

2. Reuse as much code/logic between rust and c++ clients.

3. Close to zero memory consumption.

candidates.title: Edition 2018 clean up
candidates.body:
This PR runs `cargo fix --edition` and `cargo fix --edition-idioms` on all of the modules which needed it, and includes some warning cleanup along the way. The folders  `zcash_primitives/benches/...` and `pairing/benches/...` were omitted when running the fix because they depend on unstable features, so it is possible that they no longer work. @ebfull suggested updating the benchmarks to use https://docs.rs/criterion/0.2.11/criterion/ which could be done as part of this PR, but might make more sense to be done as follow up.

Closes #97.

candidates.title: Add P2PKH transparent input support to transaction::Builder
candidates.body: Enabled by the `transparent-inputs` feature.

candidates.title: Refactor to remove sapling-crypto
candidates.body:
The modules within `sapling-crypto` have been split across the `bellman`, `zcash_primitives`, and `zcash_proofs` crates.

Part of #41. Closes #55.

candidates.title: Transaction builder
candidates.body: Supports Sapling spends, Sapling outputs, and transparent (P2PKH and P2SH) outputs.

candidates.title: Upgrade rand crate dependency to 0.7
candidates.body:
Also moves to `rand_core` where possible, to reduce the dependency surface.

Closes #60.

candidates.title: Sapling address encodings
candidates.body: The `zip32` crate is also converted into a module of `zcash_primitives`.

candidates.title: Migrate to blake2b_simd and blake2s_simd crates
candidates.body:
The primary reason for migrating is that these crates provide APIs for
setting the personalisation string. This enables us to depend solely on
published crates, and thus publish our own crates. (In order for a crate
to be published, it can't depend on unpublished ones.)

The SIMD implementations are ported from libsodium.

Closes #67.

candidates.title: Place bellman multicore operations behind a (default) feature flag
candidates.body: When the `multicore` feature is disabled, an alternate implementation of the multicore operations is used that reduces the parallelization to 1 (preventing sharding of workloads), and immediately blocks on all operations.
